document.masterDocTitle: A New Subfamily of Spiders with Grate-shaped Tapeta from Australia and Papua New Guinea (Araneae: Stiphidiidae: Borralinae)

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 7.
Couranga diehappy
. ( a,b ), male palp (holotype): a , ventral; b , retrolateral. ( c–e ), epigynum: c , ventral (KS75360); d , ventral, with plug (KS58105); e , dorsal—internal genitalia (KS75366). Scale line 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Differs from
C. diehappy
as follows: Palpal RVTA with stalk of moderate length; RDTA a thick, distally hooked process; MA processes small, subequal in size. Epigynal septum widened at middle; paired fossae with short lateral extensions.
Distribution . South-eastern New South Wales to the Border Ranges area of NSW and southeast Queensland .
Etymology . The specific name refers to Kioloa State Forest, a collection site.
